meanings.definition: The act of nullifying or making something null.
meanings.sent1: The nullification of the contract was a relief for both parties involved.
meanings.sent2: The judge declared the nullification of the marriage due to fraud.
meanings.sent3: The nullification of the ticket made the traveler chuckle at their luck.
meanings.sent4: The nullification of the law sent shockwaves through the legal community.
meanings.sent5: The nullification of the warranty left the customer feeling frustrated and unprotected.

meanings.definition: The state of being null or void.
meanings.sent1: The nullification of the document rendered it useless.
meanings.sent2: The nullification of the membership left her feeling excluded.
meanings.sent3: The nullification of the game score caused laughter among the players.
meanings.sent4: The nullification of the contract created an empty space in their agreement.
meanings.sent5: The nullification of the decision left a void in their plans.

meanings.definition: The process of invalidating or canceling something.
meanings.sent1: The nullification of the test results raised suspicions of cheating.
meanings.sent2: The nullification of the vote led to a recount of the ballots.
meanings.sent3: The nullification of the appointment caused confusion in the office.
meanings.sent4: The nullification of the permit put a stop to the construction project.
meanings.sent5: The nullification of the contract brought an end to their partnership.
